verses.roman:
sa uttamaḥ-śloka-karābhimṛṣṭo
vihāya sadyaḥ kṛkalāsa-rūpam
santapta-cāmīkara-cāru-varṇaḥ
svargy adbhutālaṅkaraṇāmbara-srak

synonyms: saḥ—it; uttamaḥ-śloka—of the glorious Lord; kara—by the hand; abhimṛṣṭaḥ—touched; vihāya—giving up; sadyaḥ—immediately; kṛkalāsa—of a lizard; rūpam—the form; santapta—molten; cāmīkara—of gold; caru—beautiful; varṇaḥ—whose complexion; svargī—a resident of heaven; adbhuta—amazing; alaṅkaraṇa—whose ornaments; ambara—clothing; srak—and garlands.
translation: Touched by the hand of the glorious Supreme Lord, the being at once gave up its lizard form and assumed that of a resident of heaven. His complexion was beautifully colored like molten gold, and he was adorned with wonderful ornaments, clothes and garlands.
